page.title: 10BRIDDLESFORD FARM, WOOTTON
page.content: The farm is located on the Briddlesford Road to the south of Wootton and is less than a mile from the village. The farm belongs to{Mr. {Griffin}and the farm is 270 acres in size.The land is mainly used for{dairy {farming.}The farmer has 80 milking cows,60 beef cattle and 30 heifers.Old cattle are sold or slaughtered at Newport.The milk is sold to the Milk Board in London. The farm's machinery consists of 2 tractors, tedder, plough, cultivator, roller and harrow. These flatten, plough or level the land ready for use. Some of the machinery can last up to ten years depending on how much use it gets. The soil is clay and much of the land is sloping though none of it is very steep.
